dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits heavily vegetated creeks, sloughs and roadside ditches.  Oviparous, eggs are deposited in aquatic vegetation (Ref. 58020).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: North America:  Edisto and Savannah River drainages in South Carolina, USA.

dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Taxonomy
dataObjects.description: Comments: MtDNA data indicate that ELASSOMA is monophyletic; see Quattro et al. (2001) for information on phylogenetic relationships among the six species in this genus (E. ALABAMAE is widely divergent; E. BOEHLKEI and E. OKATIE are sister taxa related to the widespread E. EVERGLADEI). Quattro et al. (2001) identified two evolutionarily significant units (Edisto and New-Savannah) based on mtDNA data. Furthermore, Quattro et al. (2001) found an apparent sister-group relationship between Santee River E. BOEHLKEI and Edisto River E. OKATIE (rather than with Waccamaw River E. BOEHLKEI), suggesting that current species boundaries need revision. Rohde and Arndt (1987) and some other authors placed the pygmy sunfishes (ELASSOMA sp.) in the family Elassomatidae (not recognized in the 1991 AFS checklist, Robins et al. 1991).
